content.question:
Bond
Approximate Bond Enthalpy <math alttext="(in kilojoules per mole)" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>kJ</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>mol</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="C, to H single bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math>
<math alttext="410" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>410</mn></math>

<math alttext="C, to F single bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></math>
<math alttext="490" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>490</mn></math>

<math alttext="H, to F single bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></math>
<math alttext="570" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>570</mn></math>

<math alttext="F, to F single bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></math>
<math alttext="160" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>160</mn></math>

Based on the bond enthalpies given in the table above, which of the following is the best estimate of <math alttext="delta H naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>H</mi><mo>°</mo></math> for the reaction represented below?
<math alttext="C H 4 plus F 2, react to produce C H 3 F plus H F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CH</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>→</mo><msub><mi>CH</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>HF</mi></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="negative 650 kilojoules per mole reaction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>650</mn></mpadded><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi><mo>/</mo><msub><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="negative 490 kilojoules per mole reaction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>490</mn></mpadded><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi><mo>/</mo><msub><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="positive 490 kilojoules per mole reaction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>490</mn></mpadded><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mpadded><mpadded><mi>kJ</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>mol</mi></mpadded></mpadded><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="positive 650 kilojoules per mole reaction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>650</mn></mpadded><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi><mo>/</mo><msub><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="negative 490 kilojoules per mole reaction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>490</mn></mpadded><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi><mo>/</mo><msub><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
